page.title: 13FARMING IN NEWTOWN AREA
page.content: The area contains 498 hectares of farm land, farmed by 14 farmers with areas between 13 -88 hectares. 10 are owner occupiers of 240 h.: 4 farmers have tenanted all their land and 2 supple- ment their own land by tenanting. The largest landlords are Winchester College and Southwick Estate. In 1985 61.5h.were cereal crops,4.5h. potatoes and 3h. vegetables. The remaining 429h were grass for haymaking, grazing or making sileage. One farmer sells the turf for lawn making. The heavy clay soil is reflected by the large area of grass supporting 533 beef cattle,210 milking cows and 101 young stock for replacement. They have to be taken off most fields in the winter to prevent damage to the grass crop by poaching. There are two pig farms ,two horse breeding units and a few sheep, goats and poultry are kept.
